channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9261] Add cp hooks after {start|close}RegionOperation
item.description: These hooks helps for checking Resources(blocking memstore size) and necessary locking on index region while performing batch of mutations.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch for trunk.
Patch lgtm (I like how these changes are coming in in digestible pieces). Anyone else want to looksee?

Add javadoc that postStartRegionOperation and postCloseRegionOperation don't allow bypass and lgtm.

Edit: Never mind, they are post calls. +1

When isReplay is true, there would be a postCloseRegionOperation() call which is not paired with corresponding postStartRegionOperation() call.

Should postStartRegionOperation() be passed Operation enum ? That way the two hooks would be paired.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12599135/HBASE-9261.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

lgtm

Some extra white spaces but its ok, can correct on commit.
Pass the Operation type in postCloseRegionOperation also?
Can the post hooks called for all cases of start/closeRegionOp()? Generically call in startRegionOperation & closeRegionOperation?
rajeshbabu Do u have an updated patch? Thanks

Anoop Sam John
In current patch calling postStart/CloseRegionOperation hooks at the end in start/closeRegionOperation methods such a way that hooks will be called for all the opertions in general. The hooks will be called multiple times for each operation like put but every time the Operation parameter is different like PUT,BATCH_MUTATE for postStartRegionOperation.

Please review and provide your comments. Thanks

This message is automatically generated.

Now when we call postCloseRegionOperation in all cases of close region operation, better we pass the Operation to this hook also.


+    } catch (IOException e) {

+      lock.readLock().unlock();

+      throw e;

+    }

You are ensuring the release of the read lock. Better to catch generic Exception in such a case?

Anoop Sam John
Sorry for the delay.
In the current patch Added Operation parameter to postCloseRegionOperation hook.

Better to catch generic Exception in such a case?

Catching exception instead of IOE.

Please review the latest patch.
Thanks.

Sorry I should have given this before
postCompleteBatchMutate -> Will it be fine to pass the MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp also?
I would say pls have a better name for this API.

postCompleteBatchMutate -> Will it be fine to pass the MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp also?

It will be better to pass miniBatchOp. Upload new patch for this.

I would say pls have a better name for this API.

I am not getting any other name. Can any one please suggest better name for postCompleteBatchMutate hook?
Thanks.
How about naming the hook postBatchMutateIndispensably ?

How about naming the hook postBatchMutateIndispensably ?

+1

Patch addressing Anoop's comments.
Changed postCompleteBatchMutate hook name as Ted suggested and passing miniBatchOp to it.
Thanks Ted and Anoop.

+1
Please add release notes mentioning new hooks

From test output for TestDistributedLogSplitting#testNonceRecovery :


2013-12-13 13:30:29,124 ERROR [RpcServer.handler=0,port=33741] ipc.RpcServer(2045): Unexpected throwable object 

java.lang.AssertionError

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion$ReplayBatch.getMutationsForCoprocs(HRegion.java:2013)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.doMiniBatchMutation(HRegion.java:2473)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.batchMutate(HRegion.java:2085)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.batchReplay(HRegion.java:2053)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer.doReplayBatchOp(HRegionServer.java:4266)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer.replay(HRegionServer.java:3949)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.AdminProtos$AdminService$2.callBlockingMethod(AdminProtos.java:19809)

The above was due to the following change:


+      // call the coprocessor hook to do to any finalization steps

+      // after the put is done

+      if (coprocessorHost != null) {

+        MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp =

+            new MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation>(batchOp.getMutationsForCoprocs(),

Need to check return value of batchOp.isInReplay().
nit: remove 'to' in 'to any'
TestDistributedLogSplitting passed based on patch v7.
Changes in OpenRegionHandler is not needed here right Ted? Thanks for the analysis and new patch with fix.

Good catch, Anoop - I was wondering why my patch was 1KB bigger

Correct version attached.
Ted's patch LGTM..
Thank you very much Ted for correcting it.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Added hooks postStartRegionOperation and postCloseRegionOperation after startRegionOperation and closeRegionOperation respectively. Also added postBatchMutateIndispensably hook which will be called after the completion(success or failure) of batch mutation operation.
